name: appium-agent-tools
description: VS Code extension that exposes AI-callable tools for controlling Android devices via Appium

languageModelTools.name: appium_startSession
languageModelTools.userDescription: Start a new Android Appium automation session
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Start a new Android Appium session. Connects to the Appium server and initializes a new automation session with specified capabilities.

serverUrl.description: URL of the Appium server (e.g., http://127.0.0.1:4723)

capabilities.description: Desired capabilities for the session (platformName, automationName, etc.)

languageModelTools.name: appium_stopSession
languageModelTools.userDescription: Stop the active Appium automation session
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Terminate the active Appium session and clean up resources.

languageModelTools.name: appium_findElement
languageModelTools.userDescription: Find a UI element on the device screen
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Find a UI element using a locator strategy (id, xpath, accessibility id, or class name).

value.description: The locator value to search for

languageModelTools.name: appium_tap
languageModelTools.userDescription: Tap on a UI element or screen coordinates
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Tap an element or screen coordinates. Provide either elementId or x/y coordinates.

languageModelTools.name: appium_typeText
languageModelTools.userDescription: Type text into a UI element on the device
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Type text into a focused or specified element.

languageModelTools.name: appium_swipe
languageModelTools.userDescription: Swipe vertically on the device screen (up or down)
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Perform a vertical swipe gesture. Use direction 'up' or 'down'.

languageModelTools.name: appium_screenshot
languageModelTools.userDescription: Capture a screenshot of the device screen
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Capture a screenshot of the device screen and save it to the workspace.

languageModelTools.name: appium_pageSource
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the current UI hierarchy (page source) from the device
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve the current UI hierarchy XML and save it to the workspace.
